title: SAP in three-year cloud partnership with Microsoft
text:
SAP in three-year cloud partnership with Microsoft

Stock Markets 26 minutes ago (Oct 21, 2019 06:12)

BERLIN (Reuters) - Business software group SAP disclosed on Monday it had reached a three-year deal with Microsoft (NASDAQ: ) to help its large enterprise customers move their business processes into the cloud. The partnership, called 'Embrace', will help clients to run operations in the cloud supported by SAP's flagship S/4HANA database, new Co-CEO Jennifer Morgan said as SAP released final third-quarter results in line with preliminary figures released on Oct. 11.

SAP in three-year cloud partnership with Microsoft
